Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: large hall

Spreading out before you is a hall nearly identical to the main public hall next door. However, this room is not nearly as well lit and has a much more smoky, dark atmosphere. The room is designed to be private, thanks to the dim lighting overhead, and scattered about are six circular tables set to view the stage to the north. The stage itself runs the length of the north wall of the room, with heavy gold velveteen curtains flanking either end that can be drawn open and closed. Situated in the southwest corner is a bar shaped in a semi-circle, a number of high stools crowding around it.
http://i76.photobucket.com/albums/j33/oedineeprex/shstage-1-2.jpg

well polished ivory marble bar of iridescent crackle glass

A well polished ivory marble bar, forming a semi-circle in the southwest corner. The bar top is made from smokey-grey crackle glass and features beveled edges providing a hint of elegance to an otherwise plain object. Behind the bar, a myrtle wine rack, and countless bottles of all shapes, sizes, and colors rest, the tools of the trade for a good bartender. The outside of the bar counter is flanked by a number of fixed myrtle stools.
A well polished ivory marble bar, forming a semi-circle in the southwest corner. It is flanked by stools for customers.
the bottles behind the bar
A number of glass bottles of all shapes, sizes, and colors arrayed behind the bartending counter, filled with the beverages of the trade.
A number of glass bottles of all shapes, sizes, and colors arrayed behind the bartending counter, filled with the beverages of the trade.

A high arched ceiling made of lacquered myrtle. Evenly-spaced buttresses carved with intricate floral garlands extend from the upper portions of the walls to support the high ceiling, forming a latticework pattern above your head. There is a myriad of hanging lanterns dangling from here.

A high arched ceiling made of lacquered myrtle. Evenly-spaced buttresses carved with intricate floral garlands extend from the upper portions of the walls to support the high ceiling. There is a myriad of hanging lanterns dangling from here.

the floor
The floor is covered with plush, dark green carpet suitable for muffling noise.
The floor is covered with plush, dark green carpet suitable for muffling noise.
the floral garlands
Intricately carved floral garlands spanning the length of each buttress. Miniature flowers are created in a swooping curve providing the illusion of a drape across the front of the woodwork.
Intricate floral garlands spanning the length of each buttress.
crystal chandelier
A crystal chandelier, hanging from the ceiling.
A crystal chandelier, hanging from the ceiling.
the hanging lanterns

The source of light for this room, these sage and ivory hanging lanterns dangle neatly from the ceiling. They are comprised of thin, criss-crossing bamboo reeds covered with gauzy rice paper and emit a faint, yet steady glow engulfing the room in an atmosphere of privacy.
A myriad of hanging lanterns.
brass pole at the left of the stage
A solid, polished brass pole fixed to the middle of the main stage, intended for dancing.
brass pole at the middle of the stage
A solid, polished brass pole fixed to the middle of the main stage, intended for dancing.
brass pole at the right of the stage
A solid, polished brass pole fixed to the right of the main stage, intended for dancing.
water sculpture

A water sculpture situated in the southeast corner of the hall. Atop a stately column, clear cascades of water sparkle from a red marble rose-shaped bloom, cradled by a delicate ivory marble hand. Clean, clear water glistens in the basin reflecting the lights above.
A water sculpture situated in the southeast corner of the hall.
large wooden stage

A large wooden stage that runs the length of the northern wall in a unique wave shape. It consists of raised myrtle planks which have been insufficiently sanded and then lacquered, giving the stage a clean, albeit tacky, appearance. It is flanked on either side by heavy gold velveteen curtains that have been drawn back. Set equally apart upon the stage are three brass dancing poles, one to the left, one in the middle, and one to the right.

The large, wave-shaped wooden stage running the length of the northern wall is made of raised, insufficiently-sanded myrtle planks which have been lacquered to create a clean, albeit tacky, surface for performers.

the eastern wall

The eastern wall is made up of unrefined myrtle planks. A covering of dark green velveteen has been attached and pleated at regular intervals to prevent echoing inside of the hall. Myrtle buttresses carved with intricate floral garlands arch outward from the upper portion of the wall to support the high arched ceiling.
The eastern wall is made up of unrefined myrtle planks. A covering of dark green velveteen has been attached and pleated at regular intervals to prevent echoing inside of the hall.
the northern wall

The northern wall is made up of unrefined myrtle planks. A covering of dark green velveteen has been attached and pleated at regular intervals to prevent echoing inside of the hall. Myrtle buttresses carved with intricate floral garlands arch outward from the upper portion of the wall to support the high arched ceiling. A unique, wave-shaped stage is built into this wall.

The northern wall is made up of unrefined myrtle planks. A covering of dark green velveteen has been attached and pleated at regular intervals to prevent echoing inside of the hall. A unique, wave-shaped stage is built into this wall.
the southern wall

The southern wall is made up of unrefined myrtle planks. A covering of dark green velveteen has been attached and pleated at regular intervals to prevent echoing inside of the hall. A bar is positioned in the western corner of this wall.

the myrtle wine rack
A charming slimline myrtle wine rack with one drawer rests behind the bar. It has a decorative top and base and holds fifteen bottles of various wines.
A myrtle wine rack resting behind the bar.
